info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 7:51PM EDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Funnel Clouds Possible Early This Evening... Atmospheric conditions are favorable for the development of funnel clouds early this evening. These funnel clouds normally only protrude a few hundred feet downward from the parent cloud, rotate or spin like a top, and last a few minutes before dissipating. Funnel clouds early this evening are most likely to occur along a weak, slow moving cold front which was drifting slowly south along a line from near Dixon, to Minooka and Peotone Illinois and Hebron Indiana. Funnel clouds will become less likely with the approach of sunset and the loss of daytime heating. These funnel clouds rarely touch the ground and typically do not pose any sort of hazard. The atmospheric conditions that these funnel clouds develop in do not support strong, damaging tornadoes. However, on extremely rare occasions, these funnels can briefly touch the ground and produce very minimal, if any, damage. If threatening weather approaches, move indoors to a place of safety. The National Weather Service will continue to closely monitor the situation.
